test_questions.question: In a file contains the line "I am a boy\r\n" then on reading this line into the array str using fgets(). What will str contain?

test_questions.opta: open "source.txt" in binary mode for reading
test_questions.optb: open "source.txt" in binary mode for reading and writing
test_questions.optc: Create a new file "source.txt" for reading and writing
test_questions.explanation: The file source.txt will be opened in the binary mode.

test_questions.opta: The first character in the file
test_questions.optb: A structure which contains a char pointer which points to the first character of a file.
test_questions.optd: The last character in the file.
test_questions.explanation: The fp is a structure which contains a char pointer which points to the first character of a file.
r+ Open an existing file for update (reading and writing).
Extra parameter in call to fclose().

The file source.txt is opened in read mode and target.txt is opened in write mode. The file source.txt contains "To err is human".
Inside the while loop,
 ch=getc(fs); The first character('T') of the source.txt is stored in variable ch and it's checked for EOF.
 if(ch==EOF) If EOF(End of file) is true, the loop breaks and program execution stops.
 If not EOF encountered, fseek(fs, 4L, SEEK_CUR); the file pointer advances 4 character from the current position. Hence the file pointer is in 5th character of file source.txt.
 fputc(ch, ft); It writes the character 'T' stored in variable ch to target.txt.
The while loop runs three times and it write the character 1st and 5th and 11th characters ("Trh") in the target.txt file.

test_questions.question: Out of fgets() and gets() which function is safe to use?
test_questions.explanation: Because, In fgets() we can specify the size of the buffer into which the string supplied will be stored.

fp = fopen("DUMMY.C", "w"); A file DUMMY.C is opened in write mode and returns the file pointer to fp
t = fileno(fp); returns the handle for the fp stream and it stored in the variable t
printf("%d\n", t); It prints the handle number.
